        The scale st the map's width == screen width (should be set depending on AR, but this works for 16:9)

      • setListeners

      • initPaints

        private void initPaints()
        Loads the paints (used by the canvas) that draw various graphics to the screen, done here to avoid creating a new Paint every time we draw something

      • loadBuilding

        void loadBuilding()
        Attempts to load the building from assets. Should never fail on a working build as the assets don't change, but handles errors because java doesn't like it if it doesn't

      • startNavSelect

        private void startNavSelect(android.widget.Button btn)
        Changes the app state st when you select a location, it is used for navigation. Sets the text, icon and listener of the button it came from
        Parameters:
        btn - The Button object that this came from, one of navigation_src_btn or navigation_dst_btn

      • onPhotoTap

        public void onPhotoTap(android.widget.ImageView view,
                       float x,
                       float y)
        Selection by search. Note that it calls select(Location) not showLocation(Location) as selection may be used for navigation not just display
        Specified by:
        onPhotoTap in interface com.github.chrisbanes.photoview.OnPhotoTapListener
        Parameters:
        view - The origin of the event. In our case always == mapView
        x - The 0-1 value denoting the x on the image of the tap
        y - The 0-1 value denoting the y on the image of the tap

      • refreshBuffer

        private void refreshBuffer()
        Resets the image buffer to be identical to map. Recalculates fct because… not sure. That could probably be done only once in onCreate tbh but it's not the expensive part of this method.

        s - The string to be displayed

      • formatNav

        private void formatNav()
        Place the destination and swap buttons below the source button if there is not enough space. Not working very well currently

      • deselect

        private void deselect()
        Resets selection parameters. The check is used to avoid unnecessary graphics operations

      • exitNavigation

        private void exitNavigation()
        The navigation-specific counterpart to deselect(). If a location was selected before we started navigation, go back to showing it. Otherwise just hides the nav UI

      • absDist

        private double absDist(uk.ac.bris.cs.spe.navigationaltool.graph.Location l,
                       float x,
                       float y)
        Parameters:
        l - A location
        x - X-value of a point
        y - Y-value of a point
        Returns:
        the Euclidean distance (in px) of a Location l from the point x,y

      • doNavigation

        private void doNavigation()
        The big one, the one we've all been waiting for, The actual point of our app. Uses the Navigator to compute the path between all pairs of nodes x,y, where the codes of x and y match those of navigationSrc and navigationDst respectively, then selects the path with the lowest total weight using weight(List). It draws this route to the buffer using drawPathListToBuffer(List), places dots at the start and end of the route, then shows the buffer.

      • navigate

        private void navigate(uk.ac.bris.cs.spe.navigationaltool.graph.Location from,
                      uk.ac.bris.cs.spe.navigationaltool.graph.Location to)
        Deprecated. used by old system
        Parameters:
        from - The source location
        to - The destination location

        Like drawPathToBuffer(Point, Point) but lots
        Parameters:

      • idToInt

        private int idToInt(int id)
        Because we can't store User objects primitively, it makes sense to convert them into types that can denote access rights and ability. This function converts the ID of a MenuItem (specifically, those in the drawer) to an int which we can store using SharedPreferences. We can't just use the int ID of the MenuItem because its value can change between builds. This value corresponds to that of the access variable that stores the current access rights.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the MenuItem that has been selected
        Returns:
        The integer value representing the access level corresponding to the MenuItem
        See Also:
        for an example of usage

      • intToId

        private int intToId(int in)
        Inverse of idToInt(int)
        Parameters:
        in - The value to convert to the ID
        Returns:
        The ID of the MenuItem corresponding the the access level represented by in
